entries.definition: Unplanned interruption or reduction in quality of an IT service.
Service Level Agreement - commitment between service provider and client defining expected service level.
Service Level Objective - specific measurable target for service level (e.g., 99.9% uptime).
Service Level Indicator - quantitative measure of a service level (e.g., response time, error rate).
Documented procedures for routine operations and incident response.
Blameless analysis conducted after an incident to understand what happened and prevent recurrence.
Measure of how well internal states of a system can be inferred from external outputs (logs, metrics, traces).
Designated period when an engineer is responsible for responding to production incidents.
Deployment strategy using two identical environments (blue and green) to reduce downtime and risk.
Gradual rollout strategy releasing changes to a small subset of users before full deployment.
Mean Time To Recovery - average time to restore service after an incident.
Mean Time Between Failures - average time between system failures.
